alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Houston; Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pulaski, northeastern Dooly and southeastern Houston Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Mock Springs, or 8 miles southwest of Hawkinsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hawkinsville, Hayneville, Browndale, Wallace, Grovania, Mobley Crossing, Hartford, Mock Springs, Pulaski State Prison, Klondike, Ocmulgee Banks, and Finleyson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Georgia.
